title: Explains why CCl4 is liquid and CI4 is solid

content.prompt: Which of the following best helps to explain why CCl4 is a liquid whereas CI4 is a solid when both are at 25Â°C?

choices.label: The dipole moment of the CCl4 molecule is larger than that of the CI4 molecule because Cl is more electronegative than I.

The dipole moment of the CI4 molecule is larger than that of the CCl4 molecule because there is stronger repulsion between electrons in the C-I bonds compared to the repulsion between electrons in the C- Cl bonds.
The London dispersion forces are stronger in CCl4 than in CI4 because Cl is more electronegative than I.
The London dispersion forces are stronger in CI4 than in CCl4 because CI4 has a more polarizable electron cloud than CCl4
